title: Prince William Shares How Diana's Compassion Led Him To Tackle Homelessness

title: Amid Rift, Prince William Discusses Bond With Prince Harry In Documentary

title: Elon Musk Says He Can Cut $2 Trillion From Budget At Trump Rally

title: How A Deleted LinkedIn Post Ignited Misinformation And Mass Unrest In UK

title: In Uncertain US Election, 2 Top Newspapers Refuse To Pick Sides
content: Days ahead of a close presidential election, two of the most prestigious liberal American newspapers have declined to give their usual endorsements to the Democratic Party candidate, sparking furious reactions.

title: Stein, Oliver, West: Know The US Third-Party Candidates
content: The US presidential election is a toss-up between Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump. However, the two-party system still left room this year for three fringe players who could yet influence an ultra-tight election on November 5.

title: What If Donald Trump Loses US Elections

title: McDonald's Rules Out Beef Caused E. Coli. To Resume Quarter Pounder Sales
content: Beef patties have been ruled out as the source of the E. coli outbreak, McDonald's said on Sunday, adding the fast-food giant will soon resume sales of its quarter-pounder hamburgers.
summary: Beef patties have been ruled out as the source of the E. coli outbreak, McDonald's said on Sunday, adding the fast-food giant will soon resume sales of its quarter-pounder hamburgers.

title: UK Teen Discovers Child Trust Fund Left With Just 12 Pounds After Surprise Fees

title: How A Melting Iceberg Is Reshaping Marine Ecosystems
content: A massive iceberg, A-68, which broke off from Antarctica's Larsen C Ice Shelf in 2017, has created a distinctive marine environment during its four-year drift, according to recent scientific analyses.
summary: A massive iceberg, A-68, which broke off from Antarctica's Larsen C Ice Shelf in 2017, has created a distinctive marine environment during its four-year drift, according to recent scientific analyses.

title: Georgian Opposition Calls For Protest, EU Demands Investigation
content: The Georgian opposition called for protests on Monday and the European Union demanded an investigation into "irregularities" after a disputed legislative vote that showed a win for the ruling party accused of moving towards Russia's orbit.
summary: The Georgian opposition called for protests on Monday and the European Union demanded an investigation into "irregularities" after a disputed legislative vote that showed a win for the ruling party accused of moving towards Russia's orbit.
